column4: if I have succesfully installed-upgraded ALSA via AlsaUpgrade-1.0.23-2.sh, and when running cat /proc/asound/version I get cat: /proc/asound/version: No such file or directory, what should I do? U can see the ALSA information of my laptop in http://www.alsa-project.org/db/?f=1b0fa73915fd1553ddd7b381181bb2a64abde167
uhh why did you update via a script?
if you want new versions of alsa, just update the normal way
no its in your bash history file, it pushes all commands back so only the oldest is erased to make space
